title._content: Bearded Man with a Velvet Cap _TheMET(7)

description._content: [This photograph was Identify the Painter (52) ] Govert Flinck Dutch, Cleve 1615-1660 Amsterdam Detail from: Bearded Man with a Velvet Cap Oil on wood Signed and dated (left center): G. flinck f.1645 Flinck, though Russian by birth, was an Amsterdam artist, and one of Rembrandt’s leading pupils of the 1630s. His portraits and history pictures remained superficially faithful to Rembrandt’s manner until the 1650s, when he, like Van der Helst and Bol, turned to a lighter, looser style based on Flemish models. Bequest of Collis P. Huntington, 1900 25.110.27 From the placard: Metropolitan Museum of Art
